evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody

extracted.value: 2025-07-30: Release of petitioner Osorto from immigration custody under bond conditions

evidence.text: The district court granted Plaintiffs’ application for the TRO. The Court sets a hearing on both of Plaintiffs Ex Parte Applications (ECF Nos. 38, 45) on Thursday, July 10, 2025, at the new time of 1:00 pm. ... The Court notes that this briefing schedule is what Defendants requested in their Ex Parte Application to Extend Defendants Time to Oppose Plaintiffs' Ex Parte Applications. ECF No. 40.

The district court determined that Plaintiffs had shown they are likely to succeed in proving that seizures requiring reasonable suspicion have occurred ... The district court issued the requested TRO on July 11.

the district court’s order ... is necessary to provide complete relief to the Plaintiffs with standing, we conclude that the district court did not abuse its discretion by entering an order that applies throughout its district.

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Petitioner Carlos Osorto shall be immediately released from immigration custody subject to the posting of a $5,000 bond, and subject to the condition that he be placed on location monitoring with an ankle monitor.

extracted.value: released from immigration custody subject to the posting of a $5,000 bond, and subject to the condition that he be placed on location monitoring with an ankle monitor
